body_content.explanation:
abbreviation for 
Ehlers-Danlos syndrome : a group of inherited conditions (= ones passed from parent to child) affecting connective tissue (= the tissue that supports the structure of skin, bones, organs, etc.), which may for example allow the skin to stretch too much or the body to bend too easily:
examples: Patients with EDS present with hyper-elasticity of the skin and hypermobile joints.
EDS is a genetic condition that affects connective tissue, the type of tissue in the body that provides support, structure, stability and normal scar formation.
